meanings.definition: The act of mocking or ridiculing someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her mockery of his dance moves made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The children's mockery of the teacher's accent was unkind.
meanings.sent3: The playful mockery of her friend's fashion sense was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The movie's portrayal of high school as a jungle was a mockery of reality.
meanings.sent5: The clown's exaggerated mockery of the king left the audience in stitches.

meanings.definition: Something that is made to look like a real object but is not real.
meanings.sent1: The toy car was a cute little mockery of a real race car.
meanings.sent2: The fake diamond necklace was just a mockery of true luxury.
meanings.sent3: The cardboard castle was a playful mockery of a grand fortress.
meanings.sent4: The artificial flowers were a mockery of nature's beauty.
meanings.sent5: The plastic fruit on the table was a sad mockery of real produce.

meanings.sent1: His mockery of the president's speech was not appreciated.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's mockery of famous singers was hilarious.
meanings.sent3: The parody show was a lighthearted mockery of popular TV series.
meanings.sent4: The satirical play was a clever mockery of political figures.
meanings.sent5: The disrespectful mockery of the national anthem caused outrage.
